status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
lihalite commented on pull request #4914: ARROW-5979: [FlightRPC] Expose opaque (de)serialization of protocol types
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4914
 
 
   Motivation: make it easier for non-Flight services to consume/produce Flight types. For instance, a REST service may want to produce FlightInfo or Ticket objects for a Flight client. This gives us an (opaque) serialization of a few protocol types that can be deserialized and then used as normal.
   
   I've noticed some of the Java APIs accidentally expose conversions to/from Protobuf types; if it's worth it, I can go back and make those private.
   
   Personal Travis: https://travis-ci.com/lihalite/arrow/builds/119836432
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

jacques-n commented on issue #4914: ARROW-5979: [FlightRPC] Expose opaque (de)serialization of protocol types
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4914#issuecomment-513339724
 
 
   Let's try to keep all protobuf types hidden (by fixing or avoid displaying). For example, you are exposing a new protobuf based exception in this patch. Can we use something more generic like IOException?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

jacques-n commented on pull request #4914: ARROW-5979: [FlightRPC] Expose opaque (de)serialization of protocol types URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4914#discussion_r306502182 ########## File path: java/flight/src/main/java/org/apache/arrow/flight/FlightDescriptor.java ########## @@ -92,6 +94,28 @@ public boolean isCommand() { return b.setType(DescriptorType.PATH).addAllPath(path).build(); } + /** + * Get the serialized form of this protocol message. + * + *

Intended to help interoperability by allowing non-Flight services to still return Flight types. + */ + public byte[] toByteArray() { + return toProtocol().toByteArray(); + } + + /** + * Parse the serialized form of this protocol message. + * + *

Intended to help interoperability by allowing Flight clients to obtain stream info from non-Flight services. + * + * @param serialized The serialized form of the FlightDescriptor, as returned by {@link #toByteArray()}. + * @return The deserialized FlightDescriptor. + * @throws IOException if the serialized form is invalid. + */ + public static FlightDescriptor fromByteArray(byte[] serialized) throws IOException { Review comment: Random thought... what do you think about using bytebuffer in these methods (or bytebuf)? It makes things more consistent with the rest of Arrow. ---------------------------------------------------------------- This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service. pitrou commented on pull request #4914: ARROW-5979: [FlightRPC] Expose opaque (de)serialization of protocol types
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4914#discussion_r306850159
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/flight/types.h
 ##########
 @@ -113,8 +113,21 @@ struct ARROW_FLIGHT_EXPORT FlightDescriptor {
 
   bool Equals(const FlightDescriptor& other) const;
 
+  /// \brief Get a human-readable form of this descriptor.
   std::string ToString() const;
 
+  /// \brief Get the wire-format representation of this type.
+  ///
+  /// Useful when interoperating with non-Flight systems (e.g. REST
+  /// services) that may want to return Flight types.
+  Status SerializeToString(std::string* out) const;
+
+  /// \brief Parse the wire-format representation of this type.
+  ///
+  /// Useful when interoperating with non-Flight systems (e.g. REST
+  /// services) that may want to return Flight types.
+  static Status ParseFromString(const std::string& serialized, FlightDescriptor* out);
 
 Review comment:
   Nit: call this `Unserialize` or `UnserializeFromString` perhaps? I feel the "Serialize" / "Parse" asymmetry will get confusing.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

pitrou commented on pull request #4914: ARROW-5979: [FlightRPC] Expose opaque (de)serialization of protocol types
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4914#discussion_r306850507
 
 

 ##########
 File path: python/pyarrow/_flight.pyx
 ##########
 @@ -232,6 +237,34 @@ cdef class FlightDescriptor:
                 type(descriptor)))
         return (<FlightDescriptor> descriptor).descriptor
 
+    def serialize(self):
+        """Get the wire-format representation of this type.
+
+        Useful when interoperating with non-Flight systems (e.g. REST
+        services) that may want to return Flight types.
+
+        """
+        cdef c_string out
+        check_status(self.descriptor.SerializeToString(&out))
+        return out
+
+    @classmethod
+    def parse(self, serialized):
 
 Review comment:
   Call this `unserialize`?

issuetype.description: A new feature of the product, which has yet to be developed.
issuetype.name: New Feature

fields.description: It would be nice to be able to serialize/deserialize Flight types (e.g. FlightInfo) to/from the binary representations, in order to interoperate with systems that might want to provide (say) Flight tickets or FlightInfo without using the Flight protocol. For instance, you might have a search server that exposes a REST interface and wants to provide FlightInfo objects for Flight clients, without having to listen on a separate port.
